justification: The PHQ-9 is a nine-item self-report tool used to screen for depression by indicating symptom severity, with responses scored from 0 to 3, with a maximum total score of 27, demonstrating good psychometric values.

The GAD-2 is a shortened version of the GAD-7 and uses two core anxiety questions rated from 0 to 3, demonstrating validity and reliability, with a cutoff score of 3 or higher indicating likely anxiety.

measured_by: ADHD Symptom and Side Effect Tracking Scale (ASSET)
justification: The ASSET is a 10-item self-report tool for assessing ADHD symptom severity with a companion list of assorted side effects. It uses a 6-point severity rating (1 = no problem present; 6 = severe impact) and a factor score calculated as a weighted sum of the ten severity items, with a cut-off of 4.40 indicating high sensitivity and specificity.

The CGI-S, which assesses Severity of Illness on a 7-point scale from 1 (normal) to 7 (extremely ill), has proven useful in evaluating a variety of mental health conditions and shows good validity comparable to similar scales.
